title: Understand the formula for enthalpy change
text: The change in enthalpy ΔH when a gas is heated is calculated using the formula: ΔH $$=n$$ * $$C_p$$ * ΔT where $$n$$ is the number of moles, $$C_p$$ is the molar heat capacity at constant pressure, and ΔT is the change in temperature.

title: Compute the temperature change
text: To find ΔT, subtract the initial temperature from the final temperature: ΔT $$=$$ T_{final} - T_{initial}. In this problem, T_{final} $$=$$ 800K andT_{initial} $$=$$ 300K. What's the value of ΔT?

title: Calculate ΔT
text: What is the change in temperature (ΔT) when neon is heated from $$300$$ K to $$800$$ K?

title: Apply the formula for enthalpy change
text: Use the formula ΔH $$=$$ $$n$$ * $$C_p$$ * ΔT with $$n$$ $$=$$ $$3.00$$, $$C_p$$ $$=$$ $$\frac{5}{2}$$ R, and ΔT you've calculated.

title: Calculate $$C_p$$
text: Given that $$C_p$$ $$=$$ $$\frac{5}{2}$$ R and the value of R $$=$$ $$8.314$$ $$\frac{J}{mol·K}$$, compute the value of $$C_p$$.

title: Calculate the change in enthalpy
text: Substitute $$n$$ $$=$$ $$3.00$$, $$C_p$$ $$=$$ $$20.785$$ $$\frac{J}{mol·K}$$, and ΔT $$=$$ 500K into the equation ΔH $$=n$$ * $$C_p$$ * ΔT to find the enthalpy change in J.

title: Convert ΔH to kilojoules
text: After calculating ΔH in joules, convert it into kilojoules by dividing by $$1000$$. What is the final answer in kilojoules?
